name: Tartrazine (FD&C Yellow 5)
foods: Fruit squash, fruit cordial, coloured fizzy drinks, instant puddings, cake mixes, custard powder, soups, sauces, ice cream, ice lollies, sweets, chewing gum, marzipan, jam, jelly, marmalade, mustard, yoghurt and many convenience foods together with glycerine, lemon and honey products.
notice: Provokes asthma attacks, urticaria in children, linked to thyroid tumors, chromosomal damage. Tartrazine appears to cause the most allergic and/or intolerance reactions of all the azo dyes, particularly amongst those with an aspirin intolerance and asthmatics. Other reactions can include migraine, blurred vision, itching, rhinitis and purple skin patches. In conjunction with E210 tartrazine appears to create an over-activity in children.
